meanings.sent1: The exuviates of the snake were found near the rock.
meanings.sent2: The exuviates of the crab were scattered on the beach.
meanings.sent3: The exuviates of the insects made a crunchy sound underfoot.
meanings.sent4: The exuviates of the lobster lay like delicate lace on the ocean floor.
meanings.sent5: The exuviates of the cicada shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Cast off old skin or shell
meanings.sent1: After molting, the snake exuviates its old skin.
meanings.sent2: The crab exuviates its shell to grow bigger.
meanings.sent3: The insects exuviates their exoskeletons like tiny magicians.
meanings.sent4: She exuviates her past mistakes and moves forward with confidence.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar exuviates its skin to reveal a vibrant new form.

meanings.sent1: The snake exuviates its old skin to make room for the new one.
meanings.sent2: She exuviates the outdated beliefs to embrace a fresh perspective.
meanings.sent3: The crab exuviates its shell with a sense of relief.
meanings.sent4: He exuviates the unnecessary clutter from his life.
meanings.sent5: The butterfly exuviates its chrysalis to emerge in all its glory.
